node.title: Dean Stockwell from Quantum Leap, countless films, dies aged 85
node.alt: Dean Stockwell sits on a bench.
node.description: Dean Stockwell was a top Hollywood child actor who gained new success in middle age with the sci-fi series Quantum Leap and a string of indelible film performances.
node.content:
["Dean Stockwell, a former Hollywood child actor who gained new success in middle age with the sci-fi series Quantum Leap\u00a0and in a string of indelible film performances, has died.", "Jay Schwartz, a family spokesperson, said Stockwell died aged 85 of natural causes at home over the weekend.", "His film credits included David Lynch's Blue Velvet,\u00a0Wim Wenders's Paris, Texas, and Jonathan Demme's Married to the Mob.", "Stockwell was nominated for an Oscar for his role as a comic mafia kingpin in the latter movie\u00a0and was a four-time\u00a0Emmy nominee in the 1990s for Quantum Leap.", "\"Dean spent a lifetime yo-yoing back and forth between fame and anonymity,\" his family said in a statement.", "\"Because of that, when he had a job, he was grateful. He never took the business for granted. He was a rebel, wildly talented and always a breath of fresh air.\"", "", "
Stockwell returned to acting in his 20s, where he won acclaim.(AP file photo)
", "The dark-haired Stockwell was a child star who had become a Hollywood veteran by the time he reached his teens.", "\"I was very lucky to have a loving and caring and sympathetic mother and not a stage mother,\" he told The Associated Press in 1989.", "Still, he stressed, it wasn't always easy, and he dropped out of the business when he reached 16.", "\"I never really wanted to be an actor,\" he said.", "But he returned in his 20s, starring\u00a0on Broadway as a young killer in the play Compulsion\u00a0and in prestigious films such as Sons and Lovers.", "He was awarded best actor at the Cannes Film Festival twice, in 1959 for the big-screen version of Compulsion\u00a0and in 1962 for Sidney Lumet's adaptation of Eugene O'Neill's Long Day's Journey Into Night.", "", "
Dean Stockwell in the 1990s TV series Quantum Leap, one of his best-known roles.(Youtube: NBC Classics)
", "While his career had some lean times, he reached his full stride in the 1980s.", "His role as Tony \"The Tiger\" Russo, a flamboyant gangster, in the 1988 hit Married to the Mob\u00a0led to his most notable TV role the following year, in Quantum Leap.", "\"It's the first time anyone's offered me a series and the first time I've ever wanted to do one,\" he said in 1989.", "\"If people hadn't seen me in Married to the Mob\u00a0they wouldn't have realised I could do comedy.\"", "He continued playing roles, big and small, in films and TV, into the 21st century, including a regular role in another science fiction series, Battlestar Galactica.", "He called his success from the 1980s onward his \"third career\", a high point of which was his Oscar nomination.", "He told AP in 1989 that it was \"something I've dreamed about for years. \u2026 It's just one of the best feelings I've ever had\".", "Stockwell is survived by his wife, Joy, and their two children, Austin Stockwell and Sophie Stockwell.", "AP/ABC"]
